description:
Great ambiance and vibe for working. Feels locally owned and unique. 

Really good prices relative to other San Francisco spots. Has sandwiches as well. Lots of outlets.
author: Henry C.

description:
I really, like really wanted to like this place. It is adorable, right on Polk and has the cutest window seats. But the coffee was not great, maybe I just got a burnt one? IDK. I would still go back that cuz it was really cute, small town coffee shop vibes even though this is a big city. 

Service was great, went on Saturday afternoon.
author: Tina L.

description:
Recommendation to the owners: move the 11pm closing hours to 2 weekdays (say Tue and Thu) from Fri and Sat. The reason why people used to love this place (but not so much now) was because of its late closing hours to get work done during weekdays. People tend to spend time elsewhere on weekends.

That would make it 5 stars for me.
author: Gokhan T.

description: I tried Honey cake and Napoleon here - it's mind-blowing. Great place for breakfast or just a cup of coffee.
author: Jelena K.

description: Five star coffee!  With best of the best Napoleon I ever try.
author: Denis L.

description: Awesome place! Very cozy and cute . I totaly recommend this place and you should to try their cake such us Napoleon and Medovik ( Honey cake).
author: Marina K.

description: This place is amazing!! Cozy and sweet. Their HONEY CAKE is the way to go - it is just melting in your mouth, just the right sweetness!!  Barista is charming and super friendly,always make me feel like home))) I gave them preferance rather than other coffee shops in the neighborhood for sure.
author: Vera K.

description:
I always buy coffee and cakes here, when come in San Francisco. Good location, delicious cappuccino and wonderful Napoleon and Medovik :) it's good place to have meeting with friends or for morning coffee. 
Highly recommend to visit!
author: Darina B.

description: I think the coffee I had was really mediocre. I never even finished it. I got a cappuccino. It was literally all foam. I stirred it for 5 minutes to get to a state where there is something to drink and then immediately realized that the coffee was bitter and not worth it :/ my friend took a regular black coffee and he couldn't drink his either.
author: Shashank C.

description:
This is a very cool place!
Very comfortable to work there: they have wifi and friendly people who work there.
The Hazelnut coffee is the best of all I've ever tried!
Place is small and cozy. 
Royal Ground always have something new to try!
I recommend this place to everyone!
author: Yulia T.

description: The owners are very nice guys. I order espresso and breakfast bagels every single morning and love them a lot. It is very nice place for relaxing because it is really quiet place.
author: Anastasya T.

description: The most delicious pastry I've had in a long time! Pretty good selection of tea and nice atmosphere! Great place if you looking to spend an hour or longer at nice cafe
author: Nataliya B.

description: Great coffee and a nice small place. Get the almond chai latte. It is amazing. Also, yay for great wifi.
author: Jason S.

description:
I fear that neighborhood cafes like Royal Grounds are being taken for granted in the ever-gentrifying West Bay.

Yes, the décor and the interior might be a bit dated, what with the motley mismatched furniture, but it's still a dependable place for a solid drink and some decent light bites to go with it. Prices are quite reasonable, service is friendly, and the wi-fi is free. There's a modest amount of seating. Best of all, the shop is open fairly late for places of its kind, so you can read, recharge, or get some work done almost any time of day. 

Here's hoping Royal Grounds stays around and doesn't give way to, say, some eating establishment offering "upscale artisan handcrafted fare."
author: Vincent L.

description: Hands down the worst chai that I've ever ordered. Way too much cinnamon and had an acetone underlying flavor.
author: Alena C.

description: My niece's hazelnut breve was pretty good, but my chai latte on the other hand was watered down. A bit disappointed in that. I do appreciate the atmosphere, it was cozy and service was quick and friendly. I enjoyed the outdoor seating and people watching as well.
author: Nani V.

description: This coffee tasted awful almost like it was barbecue. In addition it took quite some time to be served and our breakfast bagel was pretty bad as well. I asked for the bacon crispy it wasn't. I wouldn't go to again.
author: Ani J.

description:
Been hanging out here since 2001.

The coffee is strong. The food is good. The patrons are colorful. The Wi-Fi signal is strong. There are enough electrical outlets to do work.

Two things we don't like: aggressive/entitled people, and people having phone conversations: step outside like a civilized person.

Tell Denis & Veronica Kevin sent you.
author: Kevin M.

description:
My current go to in the morning before starting my day. The owner/barista Dennis is friendly and when you order for here he brings the food/drink to you. 

The place is small but in a good way comfortable small. There's plenty of outlets for laptop use. On evenings there's locals playing chess. I've been to the other location on Outer Richmond and I'll say I like both but prefer this spot.
author: Kenneth L.

description: It was super humid in here when I came in. No one cracked a door or window or anything. Room temperatured water is available but the spot where the cups were was kind of gross; there were flies. Decent coffee selection. Not the best cappuccino in the world but the barista who was working alone was great; friendly and a hard worker. He was the best part. Not sure I'd come back
author: Elizabeth G.

description:
Real strong coffee. Nice staff. Brewed does it. Each day of three it tasted even better. Full mouth feel, not over roasted. Just rich. Latte was okay; real good latte would have pulled five stars.

Solid, beefy breakfast sandwiches, hot and fresh. No problem getting seat and some space at 8-8:30 am.
author: Michael S.

description: This place is just awesome for a cup of great coffee and a piece of cake. Today I tried Russian Honey cake and it was amazing, not too sweet and not too battery, light and creamy. Would definitely come back to test more of their cakes and all the types of coffee!
author: Katerina P.

description: I like this place, the baristas are always nice and it's solid neighborhood spot. Coffee is good and they have a nice selection of food to eat. Mainly I like the fact you can sit here and work or read and it always feels like a calm, sunny place-you don't feel rushed and it has real charm.
author: Lily R.

description: The coffee, snacks, and vibe a great. I like the place. Lots of seating and not bad internet to boot. My issue (big issue) with this place is that it is a sweat shop. They REALLY need to keep this place cooler. It's too hot to work comfortably for me. Looking around I see a sweat sheen on many other faces. Not just me.
author: Nick B.

description: Cozy family owned place with plenty of yummy choices. I love their herbal teas in cool looking tea mugs. There is something special about this cafe that makes me wanted to cone back. Highly recommend to stop by.
author: Anasmokra S.

description: When I got a watery latte I thought I may have just come on a bad day.  I just got a regular cup of coffee and it tastes like burnt wood.  Cozy place to hang out and do work, though.
author: Gaurav O.

description: Amazing pastrami sandwich: fresh ingredients, right recipe. Good coffee. Really nice place.
author: Andrey T.

description: This coffee shop is a great if you need to get work done, read, or study. Great organic coffee, sweet barista. It closes late and there is rarely loud talking or loud traffic in and out of the shop. I really enjoy this place and recommend it to everyone!
author: An N.

description:
This place is so special! Always amazing coffee,  delicious food and friendly staff!!!
Good luck,  guys!!!
author: Olga C.

description: Yesterday I found one more place for a real good coffee! I always take espresso in a Cafe to know the quality of the coffee. And it It was amazing! I even bought 2 bags of coffee beans with different flavor for myself I also had a pleasure to chat with current owners of the Cafe (very friendly and polite guys ). And I was impressed how they respect the history of the Cafe and their visitors. I did't try anything from the menu yet, I'll do it next time for sure! I saw that they have some tasty pies They call them "Piroshki"! So next time I'll go there for breakfast.
author: Victoria F.

description: They serve great Russian style honey cake - absolutely delicious!
author: Elena Z.

description: Cute neighborhood with delicious coffee with great honey cake! Friendly customer service.
author: Katerina S.

description:
One of the best coffee shops as the Name Royal Ground Coffee , very tasty coffee , delicious sandwiches , very good service, free WiFi 
 All what I can say very good place to relax your mind
author: Nooraldeen A.

description: Very nice place. Been going there for a couple of years now. Good service, food and of course cofee.  It's a family owned place and that's what makes it cool. Good alternative to always noisy Starbucks. Unique environment in the area (check out the pics).
author: Ivan V.

description: I stopped in because I needed caffeine badly and had to use the restroom as well as charge my phone. Iced hazelnut coffee was amazing, staff was super friendly and they even had the doublet phone charging units. So happy!
author: L D.

description: I meant to do a review for this gem of a coffee shop a couple weeks back but anywho, this is a great place to study and grab a cup of tea, or coffee, while you submerse yourself in that novel you've been meaning to catch up on or that research paper you've been putting off for a couple weeks. Get that midnight oil burning! This place is open late: great!
author: Evin S.

description:
There's not much to say here. It's a quiet little Polk Street coffee shop. There's a lot of variety in terms of coffee, tea and pastries. The space is cozy and the staff are friendly. Coffee itself was good and the apple danish was delicious. They aren't breaking new grounds or anything like that, but I doubt any of us will be coming here looking for anything revolutionary.

If this area is where you normally go to grab your morning coffee, you can't go wrong making a stop here once or twice. The prices are very reasonable (less than 2 bucks for a cup) and the service is much faster than more popular spots in the area for that very reason.
author: Alex B.

description:
A small, quaint neighborhood gem! This little cafe is tucked away on Polk St. and is perfect for people like me who work late and can't focus at home (they are open until 11 PM). The gentlemen who greeted me at the counter was very nice and soft spoken. He was also kind enough to bring my latte over to where I was sitting. Aside from coffee & espressos, they serve tea, smoothies, sandwiches, bagels, and a fridge full of Odwalla juices. 

The cafe looks a little old, with random decor all over the place, but that's what makes it unique! It has personality and isn't stiff like some other cafe's I've been to. Everyone in the cafe is doing their own thing - whether it's working on a laptop or reading the paper. Which was nice, because nobody was distracted by any loud noise or talking. It's just a peaceful & cozy little cafe. Great for getting work done and much more relaxing than sitting in a loud and crowded Starbucks!
author: Chisholm T.

description: Cowboy coffee in a warm setting at a fraction of the price as their new Apple Store ambianced and priced look-alikes down the street.
author: Dan B.

description: Holy shit I'm in love. I keep saying I think I've found my favorite SF coffee place, but nope, this is it. Here on a Saturday night. Feels local. People are playing chess. Good coffee. Quiet. Cafe music. Fast wifi. Person working (not sure if owner?) hits the perfect sweet spot of friendly but not too friendly. Don't even care if there's no paleo friendly food for me. Perfection.
author: Michelle C.

description: They make the shit out of your coffee, and their (although limited) choice of sandwiches and bagels are surprisingly kickass. Perfect place for nerds/library hermits like me to stop by and get some work done.
author: P.j. J.

description: I have a soft spot for family run places, and this is a wonderful coffee shop in the neighborhood.  Good food, fast service, and a great place to work from if you are a remote worker.
author: Chris M.

description: Very good coffee and decent priced , this dimmed vintage looking coffee shop looks very cozy . Enjoyed my time reading a book there
author: Momo P.

description: Phony. First time in and stood in line for 10 min only to find out they don't serve sandwiches after 8. It was as about 8:05 when I left the place. Didn't order anything. A sign for that would help especially when you only have one employee working.
author: Werd R.

description:
Down home - old SF - non gentrified- warm cozy vibe and a good place to start and end the day!

Best demographics I've seen in most coffee shops?!  

Also current tribute to the Russian Hill neighborhood for being able to keep it's "mom and pop" vibe alive somewhere this city!
author: Anthony V.

description: A touch of an old school 90s era SF coffee shop. Decent enough food and drinks and plenty of space to work.
author: Manny J.

description: Just spent several hours here after I couldn't find a plug at Saint Frank down the block. I bought a bagel and have sat here all day with free fast wifi and endless outlets and a long table with my feet up on another chair. They are so nice. Me and my work from home leggings are coming here again for sure.
author: Samia K.

description: Excellent coffee, fast service, the cutest ceramic coffee mugs matching with the tiles of the tables outside. Cozy, colorful, companionship. Open til late at night (was trying to get a coffee and could not find any other place open and Yelp brought me to this small and filled with people that look like they have been going there forever, casual and friendly atmosphere, nothing pretentious in there.
author: Carmen V.

description: This is my favorite cafe to go to for studying and doing work. It's typically pretty quiet except you sometimes get some people holding conversations at the table. I find this cafe to be more of a working cafe rather than a conversation cafe but oh well! There's a lot of outlets and seating. The coffee is pretty good and the service is great. The person working behind the counter is always very nice.
author: Lisa C.

description: Good place to have a lunch break or for working. There are plugs and free wifi. The food is good and there are a lot of hot drinks choices
author: Céline S.

description: Best service, coffee&bagel, price and location. Full of love and passion. Love this unique cafe on Polk!
author: Donna Z.

description:
Didn't feel like going to the chain coffee shops & needed an afternoon pick me upper. Decided to Yelp a local spot. Had decent reviews so walked in .
Stopped in around 3pm ordered a black coffee with an add shot. The worse coffee I've ever had!It tasted like the coffee had sat in the coffee pot since 6am. Never again!
author: Elizabeth O.

description:
great local neighborhood coffee place. The prices are affordable, the coffee really tasty, and a few yummy looking snacks.  
The sitting area isn't huge but it's cozy and clean. There were also a few tables outside which I had no trouble sitting at on a saturday morning.
author: Alexandra S.

description:
This is my favorite cozy neighborhood coffee shop. I work from home, so when I feel like getting out of the house, I'll work from here with their free WiFi. I feel welcome sitting around and never pressured to leave.

My standard order is the Vietnamese chicken sandwich (delicious) and iced coffee (served in a variety of quirky mugs).

Also - the employees here are quiet but really stellar. Just today I saw a woman come in who had forgotten her phone and and was trying to text a friend. I'm not even sure that she bought anything, but one of the employees still let her use both his cell phone and his computer to track her friend down. I thought that was over and above.
author: Lauren S.

description:
If I was an emo artist, I would come here and create my next masterpiece. That's how hipster artsy I think this place is. I love their coffee.  

This place has a real espresso machine and yummy sandwiches! Hands up! high five! They have a variety of small bites as well. 

Friendly service and they take cards.
author: Suzzie B.

description:
Popular for playing chess late into the night!

Their kitchen closes at 10pm, but they still serve drinks after that time. 

We were kicked out at 11:30pm on a Saturday evening, even though they supposedly closed at midnight.

Be warned that you will come out smelling like roasted coffee afterwards.
author: Audrey L.

description: Quaint local shop...excellent bagels and Delilah coffee. Loved having a quick breakfast here.
author: Barb G.

description: Hung out here to work for a few hours. Nice, quiet environment and there were definitely plenty of plugs. Plus their mango smoothie is delicious.
author: Ana C.

description: This place is small and crowded. The door doesn't close, so on a cold, rainy day like today it's way too cold, and the door is broken so it doesn't stay closed. It also lets in the cigarette smoke from outside. There's very little food offered. Lots of better cafes to work at in the city if that's what you're looking for.
author: Rachel R.

description: I work from this coffee shop 2-3 times during the week.  Solid WiFi, plenty of seating, plenty of outlets, decent coffee and subpar food.  They don't allow outside foods so I bear it... but I'm really here for the work space and coffee anyway.
author: Joyce C.

description: Second day in a row here..the place is great to study, the ambience is really chill and cool. Nice people doing different kind of work, playing chess or just reading a book. Love the place and the coffee/snacks to keep your study going.
author: Sergio L.

description: Oh my gosh! This place blew my mind! I didn't even use yelp to find this place which is rare. I was walking down Polk just minding my own place when I literally stopped in my tracks to stop here because it smelled sooo good! You know how in Disney movies when the smoke smell comes off a fresh pie and lures the person over to it? Yeah, it's a lot like that LOL! This place is spacious yet cozy. They have everything you could possibly need in terms of condiments and treats also! I would hang out here if I wanted to be alone or if I had a big group of friends I wanted to hang out with. Not to mention, this particular cafe is really cheap. Go figure!! Quirky cafe up in russian hill and it was only $4 for a small soy mocha (that was DELICIOUS, way better than some of those expensive competitors tbh). Honestly, I have nothing bad to say about this adorable warm, cozy cafe! Just come here and see how my review proves itself :)
author: Makana S.

description: Not the service that I would expect from a place that has the opportunity to stand out as one of few small businesses on the street. Small quaint but not good. An obvious attempt to corners and save money leaves poor taste in my mouth. Shamelessly over priced and sub par quality. Convenience store grade with local organic price. Leaves clients feeling hustled and cheated. Surprised I am not seeing more negative reviews
author: Robert S.

description:
This is a really nice neighbourhood coffee shop. It's a small quiet place that has its own distinct charm. Ive had the mocha here and it's quite good. The sandwiches are alright too. 

The best part is they have chess, scrabble and a few other board games which you can play while you're there.
author: Zoher Z.

description:
The Royal Ground in Russian Hill has a special neighborhood feel to it, which is rare in this city. Coming here, you won't be subject to the typical nonsense of SF's pseudo-hipsters and tech-bro's (they'll all be at Saint Frank nearby). Not once have I overheard a conversation about Uber, or how Start-up B is the new Start-up A, etc. ad infinitum.

Instead, you'll find a nice community of regulars, quiet-types and hard-workers, which is something really worth treasuring. I feel comfortable when I come here, and the staff are incredibly nice and thoughtful, so I find myself always coming back. The coffee really isn't the most amazing coffee in the neighborhood but it isn't bad either, and the sandwiches are actually pretty good. 

They're open until 11 too, so coming in for a late night chat over hot cocoa is really nice.
author: Aaron J.

description: Just think homeless people and mediocre coffee. I approached the coffee shop around 7:00pm on a Monday evening. I proceeded to the cash register to purchase my latte and sat down at one of their "community tables". I say "community tables" because the gentlemen sitting at the table mentioned it was a "community table" after asking if the open seat next to him was available. After about two minutes, a homeless man walks in the front door and of course sits next to me at the "community table". I carried on studying for my exam while he began to stare at me with eyes glazed over. I didn't give him attention initially until he grabbed my computer screen and forced me to look at him. I kept my demeanor and graciously introduced myself. He said his name was Alejandro and asked me why I'm not looking at him and told me that my race is why I will not look at him. I shook his hand and asked if I can proceed with my exam without looking at him he said yes, with the smell of alcohol coming from his breath. I returned to my exam and he grabbed my latte and poured it all over his face and clothes and started drinking it. I was flabbergasted, a complete stranger just poured my coffee on himself. I then approached the two individuals working at the cash register. One was male, and the other a female. They looked at me with a blank stare and said there's nothing we can do about it. I then grabbed my belongings and left the coffee shop after paying for my coffee and the employees told me they couldn't do anything about someone disturbing the peace in their own establishment. SHAME ON YOU Royal Grounds SHAME ON YOU.
author: Dylan B.

description:
They have a really good shredded chicken sandwich that they call Banh Mi. It tastes really good as long as you're not expecting traditional Vietnamese Banh Mi. ;-) The cappuccino was comparable to Peet's - their beans taste different than Peet's, and I like both.  The foam was decent, but was much better at the Royal Grounds on Clement.
Cozy place. I love the decor - The 2 lamps in the front are hanging from fishing poles!  The workers are also nice and care about their customers.
author: MT Y.

description:
Great locale, great attitude and great coffee where I expected to find nothing like it.

I wish you guys all success!
author: Joel M.

description: This place is a local favorite!  Free WIFI, service with a smile, plenty of outlets, affordable menu, and outdoor patio seating.  Everything from bagels, sandwiches, burritos, small pastries, and smoothies are offered out of small, local coffee joint.  Open late too!  Have fun!
author: Vik M.

description: I absolutely love this place.  They just got new owners and it is even better than before.  The workers are really sweet, the internet is fast, they are open really late, and the sandwiches are super cheap and delicious.  LOVE IT.
author: Alexis C.

description:
Royal ground coffee here is very small, table and size-wise. didn't see the menu so i just told the barrista i wanted $2 worth of coffee to go when she asked what i wanted.

pour: fair traded organic coffee (m.1,95)
-bold, smooth, rich brew. great stiff/

drips:
-cheerful, perky, bubbly service.
-parking not bad on gay pride day.
author: Victor G.

description:
Very comfortable and cozy place to enjoy your morning brew of choice. 
Just a calm and collected vibe with quiet people enjoying their coffee. 

PS. the coffee is good, better than Starbucks.
author: Ronald B.

description:
In a neighborhood full of coffee shops, royal ground holds its own with distinct coziness and charm. With fair trade coffee, window and street side seats, this is a great spot to stop and watch the world go round. 

Come in with a book, blog or newspaper to read and let the waves of good vibes roll gently over you.
author: M F.

description: Great coffee! Great variety of syrups. I miss these types of places. Starbucks is just Starbucks, but this makes SF special.
author: Lana D.

description:
Small, quaint, cozy little coffee spot.

Literally surrounded by 5 other coffee shops; Peets, Bux, Brew, St.Franks... 

This is my go to for a late night work sesh-- since all the others close around 8/9.

Coffee isn't the greatest but good; service is friendly and fast; food options aren't bad either. RGC is better than Bux, Peets in my opinion.
author: Roy C.

description: Love this coffee shop! First of all, the coffee is great. Second, they have a great selection of food/snacks and plenty of places to sit. I work from home regularly and this is one of my favorite places to go work for a few hours a day. Additionally, everything is priced very well which you typically don't see from boutique coffee shops.
author: Chris C.

description: This place is fantastic for a coffee and desert! Everything is yummy with amazing internet and lovely songs playing in the background to enjoy one sunny day or even with naughty clouds.
author: Garima K.

description: Its still great
author: Court S.

description: Moving to a new neighborhood, having a great coffee place is important. I'm glad a found a place. Most important to me, the entire staff is friendly and welcoming, reminding me of a hometown coffee shop back in Vermont. I've enjoyed a few breakfast sandwiches and indulged in a Mocha, one of the best I've ever had.
author: Stephen C.

description:
Found the perfect coffee shop to sit for hours and study. They have ample tables, free WiFi, and outlets for anyone needing a place to study. The place is pleasantly busy, not super loud or hectic. 

Besides coffee they have smoothies, blended drinks with ice cream, Italian sodas, sandwiches, bagels, pastries, and quiches. 

I really like that they are open late--11 pm--in an area where most of the coffee shops close by 9 or 10 pm. 

Minus one star for the fact that it took them 55 mins to make me a veggie sandwich!

Note: There is a $5 min for credit cards. The baristas are nice and will let you pay for things later if you plan on sitting for a while and ordering more items.
author: Maliha Z.

description: Great vibe! This coffee shop is grass roots. Homely feel. Great prices and nice staff
author: Brandon C.

description: Loved the placed. Will definitely come back.  Quiet,  but with a really friendly atmosphere.  And that veggie sandwich was everything I wanted it to be.  I'm not exactly a coffee aficionado,  so you may want to get someone else's opinion there, but the real clincher for me was the great music. Super nostalgic hits from the 80s,  90s and early 2000s. Can I stay forever,  please?
author: Astrid V.

description:
It's paint ain't pretty and it's carpet's thin but when you ask me about this place I can only grin.

I really enjoy the Royal Ground. The atmosphere is very tranquillo, the staff laid back but serve you when you want to be served.

I can sit down with a wonderfully prepared cup of coffee and lose myself in a book for hours at a time.
author: Jay D.

description: Love! They are so friendly here and I am never disappointed with food or drink. Prices are reasonable. With a large selection of coffee places in the area, this is a friendly local gem.
author: Holly L.

description:
+ Open late (Weeknights til 11)
+ Free Wifi and loads of outlets considering the size of the place
- Chocolate Chip Cookie was a terrible waste of $1.95 plus calories. No cookie to bite into, just super dry stuff holding together lots of strange flavored chocolate chips. 
Coffee 'drink' hit the spot.

Simple menu, but all the basics, plus non-coffee options (cocoa, hot cider, smoothies)

I'll be back here to work, but only because they're open late with wi-fi.
author: Alissa A.

description:
Pros:
Very fast internet no matter how many people are online
Good bagels
Most of the staff is very nice and friendly
Not too hard to get a table and a very good place to get some work done
Lots of electrical outlets for a computer

Cons:
Coffee is not really all that good. If you're looking for very good coffee there are better choices
One of the workers - maybe he's manager? Does not have the best people skills and can make my ordering unpleasant
author: Eric G.

description: This place has a really great vibe. It's a hole in the wall, charming little coffee shop with board games like scrabble! Great way to spend a lazy afternoon. We got a sandwich with our mocha and liked both the drink and the food. I would recommend this place if you're looking to get a cup of coffee and read a book, get some work done or just hang out with a friend!
author: Manasvi S.

description:
I was stranded in the area and found this comfortably cozy spot!

Perfect place for a cup of Joe while you work on your laptop, play some chess, read, or chat with a friend. The shopkeeper while I visited was friendly, and a gracious host. If you like independently owned coffee shops with a personable feel, this should be visited.
author: David M.

description:
Royal Ground Coffee has the look that all coffee shops in SF should have. None of that new age bar stuff with electronic music pumping. It's just a cozy spot with cool paintings on the wall, comfortable seats, large tables, and a friendly staff. But the best part about it is the coffee. The coffee is some of the best I've had. I don't like putting any cream or sugar in my cup so it requires good tasting coffee to enjoy. I haven't been to the other Royal Ground's but this one on Polk has always served up a tasty cup. They also have pretty good wifi and it's a quiet spot to allow you to get your work done, and they're open till 11p everyday!! Definitely a top coffee spot pick for me.

Edited 12/27/17: I think the ownership changed at some point in the past couple years. Anyways, gotta knock it down a star because the coffee is no where near as good as it used to be. Other stars remain for ambience and price.
author: Gordon Z.

description: Delicious lattes, open late, free wifi, and all of the entertainment of someone backing over a Vespa right outside.
author: Walker S.

description: What's not to like about this place-   If your looking for a corporate coffee cone that's on every corner- it's across the street.  This is genuine  local low key relaxed hangout.  Super relaxed so grab a drink and chill or get caught up with those pending emails.
author: Martin P.

description: Awesome neighborhood cafe! The owners are super nice. The authentic Vietnamese banh mi is amazing!  And there are power strips everywhere. Coffee comes in quirky mugs. I love this place!
author: Vivi N.

description: Love the coffee, great atmosphere. You wouldn't get this at Starbucks or Peets! They have a composition book where you can let your mind free. Draw/write a poem/ or something random. Mines is at the 2nd last page (:
author: Suki L.

description: Coming to San Francisco after college, I looked for a while for a home-away-from-home coffee shop like what I had had in my college neighborhood. This is it! The staff is super friendly, the food and coffee is good (The lox bagels and Vietnamese sandwiches are my favorites) and reasonably priced, there's lots of comfortable seating, free wifi and outlets everywhere. Plus, they're open really early and really late, which is a big plus when I need to get something done before or after a long day at work.
author: Alex K.

description: Stepped in here to grab a tea to accompany my kindle reading. Soon after, a professional magician performed a couple of tricks for me, strangers met and bonded in French, and I was invited to the royal grounds game night on Mondays. Such a great community of interesting people here.
author: Julia K.

description: A nice spot with excellent tasting espresso.  More low key than the coffee 'big boys' down the block, less selection and fluff.  I'll be back.
author: Andy S.

description:
Good, small joint with good coffee, nice outdoor sitting, couches inside and a great vibe going. There ARE outlets along a wall, and free wifi. Great place to get lunch/coffee, work. 

Open until 11, so it's become a go-to spot for me 

Staff was also friendly!
author: Paul S.

description: Shocked to find Vietnamese coffee and a great chicken bánh mì here. Got my Vietnamese fix while getting some work done! Touché, Royal Ground. I'll be back.
author: Alex B.

description:
If you're here to play Uno, you'll probably have a fun time.

If you're just here for the coffee, you'll probably leave unhappy. 
The espresso tasted pretty torched and over-extracted, wont be coming back here again.
author: Ryan D.

description: I love this place. It's the best little coffee shop. The owner is friendly, nice music, cozy atmosphere with a unique, relaxing vibe. I love it...it's just perfect!
author: Brandy A.

description: Had the "ice cream mocha" blended & the "caramel cream latte" drinks...they have very little flavor and both tasted watery. For the price of $4.50ish for a large compared to other shops with excellent coffee/flavor in lattes and blended drinks this was a sub par experience. Other items could be excellent will give it multiple chances due to the local feel: I'm new to San Francisco so my opinion is based on an unbiased viewpoint. The atmosphere is nice and definitely fits a more neighborhood feel.
author: Matthew F.

description: This is a wonderful coffee shop. I'm surprised it doesn't have higher reviews. Probably the best service I've ever had at a coffee shop, from all the baristas I've encountered during my visits. The coffee drinks are high quality and they have Mighty Leaf tea which is my favorite. Another plus is that they stay open until 11 pm, which is the latest of any coffee shops around. If you get hungry they have some good healthy little snacks, including some gluten-free options.
author: Kristin H.

description: It could be a nice day and I could enjoy it with my coffee and sweets from the place if not the horrible experience! The rudest person I have ever met- the owner Alex! I had a small salad from next door place and coffee and desert from this one. The oner came to me and in very rude way cough. me out from my table just because I had something else on the table! That's how people can easily ruin your day, even if you are a customer, which apparently means nothing to Alex!
author: Julia S.

description:
Alex (Owner), Evette and Rene (fabulous staff), you all make my day.  Before I begin my review, self-proclaimed coffee snobs and/or Blue Bottle-Die-Hards need not respond.  Royal Ground has been serving their signature blend of five different coffees for 30 years, and this local chain of non-corporate coffee shops has had lots of success.  Yes, when you come to this location you generally have to wait for a few minutes.  That said, antsy, time-crunched, oh-so busy folks whose time is of supreme importance, go across the street to Starbucks and they'll make your drink in 90 seconds instead of three to five minutes.

My husband and I have been coming here fairly frequently for about a year and a half.  Originally we started coming because we wanted to support our local coffee shop, but now we come because of the lovely people who work here, the amazing lattes they serve, and the cozy and inviting atmosphere.  If I could work from home, this would be my "office."  On the weekends, we'll order our lattes and bagels (and they use block cream cheese, not the fake Philly spread from a tub!) and go sit outside with our dog.  Every time we order from Rene, he thanks us for coming and calls us "my friend."  Sure, any good salesman could use these words, but he clearly is a kindhearted, genuine and hard-working man who values his customers.  He even saves the salt bagels for us on the weekends (oh well, I revealed our little secret, but I had to give an example of what a true friend he really is:)!

As for the inside space, they have a little chalk-board where customers can write a joke of the day.  "What do you call an alligator in a vest?"  An investigator, of course!  "What did the fish say when he hit the wall?"  Duh...dam!!  If this kind of humor does not appeal to you, or if you'd rather sit in plush leather chairs and couches, as opposed to furniture that was either donated or purchased from Good Will, this may not be the place for you.  And that's ok!  Just realize what a little gem this is to many people in the neighborhood, and thank the staff for treating all human beings with dignity and respect.
author: Spice O.

description:
I tried to go here last night, after checking on Yelp and seeing that they're supposed to be open till midnight on Saturdays. Walked over, got there about quarter past 11. There's a bunch of people smoking talking in chairs outside, so that's a good sign. I get the door halfway open and have started to walk in when one of the girls outside, wearing an apron, says "We're closed!"

I close the door and turn to leave, saying, "Oh, sorry, I just checked Yelp and it said you're open till midnight."

So then another person, either another employee or a friend of said employee's, says in a very surly tone, "Well in that case, it must be re-opened!"

No, dude, it doesn't need to be reopened. Not a particularly keen response to a would-be customer who apologized for trying to enter after closing, explaining a mistake.

If the place isn't open to midnight, they should change their online listing of hours. When the place isn't open, they should probably not have the door unlocked and all the lights on, and they should probably remind their staff to not be a snarky jerk to people who want to spend money there, or have their staff remind their friends of that fact.
author: Vivienne P.

description:
Great coffee, friendly people, free wifi and an authentic, unpretentious vibe. Get out of Starbucks, walk across the street and check this place out! 

Bonus points for brown sugar and simple syrup!
author: Crank E.

description: Gotta love royal ground coffee in Russian hill. The atmosphere is terrific. You don't get the modern feel like most coffee house now a day but I personally prefer the classic type. I didn't ordered anything special, just a sandwich and a cup of medium coffee. The coffee is really good. coffee with cream and sugar but it's much better than a medium coffee from Starbuck or peets. Wish they have more variety for sandwiches but I ended up with a turkey and it was toasty and delicious. Definitely a new place for coffee now that I know they exist.
author: Hector W.

description: Not only is the coffee good, but EVERY TIME I have been in there, the attitude of the people working is friendly. Something that a lot of coffee places have forgotten.
author: B L.

description:
Great atmosphere and people. Workers were a little impatient with the "out-of-towner". (it was my first time) Sorry! It doesn't help that I am a coffee rookie either. :P

I had some great pastries, preferred blue berry. 

After all of my grief in ordering, they got it wrong. :( oh well, my first time. No biggie, they were more than happy to make it right, which means a lot to me. 

**Traveling business people/local cyber-squatter/I don't-want-to-work-from-home-today peeps beware**: There are NO OUTLETS!!!! (which is great because those of us computer squatters can't sit there too long.) 

I'll be back for round two and an update to upgrade my grading I am sure.
author: Brad G.

description:
I really wanted to like this place because it's right down the street and it was either this or big coffee corporations across the street, Peet's and Starbucks.

It's a great place to study if you can get a table, but the coffee isn't too great. Usually if you get a mocha or vanilla latte all the vanilla or chocolate is at the bottom so if you don't stir it beforehand neither the first half nor the second half taste too great.

Also, this place serves food, bagels and sandwiches and things, but they are ALWAYS out of them. I know this is because I come late afternoon/night but it would be nice to be able to get a snack while studying. 

Some of the people who work there are really chill and sweet, but a couple of them are not so nice, so that's kind of a hit or miss.

In conclusion, I started studying at Peets instead because their coffee is better and the people are always nice :(
author: Allie E.

description: Always a welcoming owner behind the counter and good coffee. I like the laid back atmosphere- ppl come here to catch up with friends and neighbors as well as to work on their laptops. It's a good blend.
author: Misty M.

description:
Cozy tiny coffee shop.  Free wireless internet. Vintage ambiance.  Pretty mellow place to go to for work or hanging out.   I didn't like the coffee that was served here. It was extremely bitter and sour.  Wasn't sure about the quality of the coffee.  All I know is I didn't feel well afterwards.  
This place was pretty dark when I came here.  It was very hard for me to focus cause of the sad energy there.  Decided to leave and worked out of Nook.
author: Ying F.

description:
Wicked friendly folks working behind the counter here. I love that when you have a seat while you wait for your coffee & bagel, they'll just walk it on over to you when it's ready like a nice human being (read: this isn't Starbucks!).

The coffee is great, the bagels are fantastic, and the shop is begging for you to hole up in one of their decades-old chairs with a good book.

PS - bonus points to the owner for featuring jars of fresh alfajores, one of the greatest South American treats!
author: Bradley M.

description: It's a small local coffee shop with free wifi. It's a nice place to get some work done if you don't feel like dealing with the people over at Starbucks. Definitely seems like a Russian Hill local spot. Nothing fancy. Doesn't seem too packed and you can usually find a seat.
author: Ryan L.

description:
Lovely and charming cosy place. However, after talking to few customers, we agreed, coffee is not good. 
I watch the lady Barister and the coffee is already sitting inside the Expresso machine.
The coffee is bad, no joke. Do something. Clean the expresso machine, choose better beans quality, grind last minute.
Seriously. Consider Lavazza, illy, Segafredo.
Thanks!
author: stephanie b.

description: I finally tried Royal Ground Coffees. I like to try out the neighborhood coffee shops for the perfect latte. The service was excellent - really polite personnel. I liked the ambiance- great artwork on the walls. They had a nice assortment of baked goods also. The latte was not quite as strong as I like, but I do not think I'm the norm. I'll definitely be back when strolling down Polk Street!
author: Karin R.

description:
Holding court.

Previously confirmed four star coffee: http://www.yelp.com/biz/royal-ground-coffee-san-francisco-2#hrid:5ViKDyOZwVEYGsbl8ihGKA

Same story here. Americano with sugar free vanilla was great and less than three bucks. Service was warm and welcoming.

This location has more people. Windows for great Polk Street people watching. And for some reason all the outlets all on one side of the room. Head left when you enter.

Don't forget to stop at the counter first to get a cup of smooth, reasonably priced java.
author: Jason B.

description:
This is totally decent espresso without any pretentiousness about. LOVE it. It's a coffee shop that reminds me of the coffee shops of yore (that's pre-Starbucks kiddies).

And they are open LATE (for this 'hood anyway). Thanks for that!

I like that they have books to read and even a GAMES NIGHT (I want to go but I've been chicken for 7 whole years. Terrible.) I should go.

Anyway, great espresso and espresso drinks. Love you guys.
author: Holden P.

description: Love Royal Ground, come here on Saturday mornings.  Tradition.  Good coffee, friendly staff, and good price points
author: Christopher K.

description:
Safe area, pretentious yuppie tettittory but at least I'm not dealin with the crack monsters lol . So heres why the low rating; I go get a pop from the frig and I notice some guy an employee in position to GRAB ME!! Really even if I was going too steal, a frickin ONE DOLLAR POP IS WORTH ASSAULTING A TOTAL STRANGER. Note to self: after surgery get the hell out of that crack head city.. Ugh
So yeah not recommended. I suggest Starbucks... Its right across the street.
author: Crista S.

description:
Coming here was totally random. I didnt feel like going to Blue Bottle since i was pretty far from the nearest store and it was almost 7pm. So i just picked this spot. 
Place is pretty quiet. I see people inside with labtops, so i guess it has free wifi. I sat outside since the weather was good, not too hot nor too cold. Just perfect. Ordered a cup of two shot cappuccino. It's pretty good since it doesnt taste watered down. Sat here for about two hours while enjoying my drink with my friend. Good place to chill if you dont mind the hard parking near polk st.
author: Albert W.

description:
I have been to 2 Royal Ground Coffees and still loving it!  I didn't expect any less for this Royal Ground Coffees.  The environment was great, very cozy and comfy.  This time I went there to study for the final with my friend.  The coffee was great, the nutella bagel was even better, toasty and warm.  It was a great place to study because it's quiet, but I don't want to bother anyone either cause everyone else is so quiet.  Me and my friend were quizzing each other.  The only down side is that the place is too small.  When I got there, there were any seat inside already, so we had to sit outside.  Then when some people left, we moved back inside.  It has wi-fi too.

Great place to be to study and just hanging.  Will come back again!
author: Lily L.

description:
The coffee is terrible.
Do not come here for the coffee.

However.

They have outlets, good tea-in-bags, and they're open relatively late.
author: Max R.

description: Great relaxed atmosphere to sit down with a friend or do some work. Almond milk latte is delicious!
author: Sarah V.

description:
I'm not a corporate coffee hater, but I like to patronize the smaller guys when I can.  It can be hard to find a seat here with all the people taking advantage of the free WiFi, but if you can get a seat, it's a comfy place to sit and read (or play one of the board games they have, if you're so inclined).  There are also a few seats outside in the front, so if it's not freezing, I'll sit out there and watch Polk St. go by.

So you want to know about the coffee?

Well, it's hard to mess up my regular order (a 12 oz. non-fat au lait), but it's good!
author: Kimberly B.

description:
Boyfriend and I were getting donuts from the place 4 doors down. Although great donuts, its a crap place for coffee. So We traveled to Royal Ground Cafe and I needed change for a 100. The woman at the counter was so nice to me. She took the time to ground the beans for my coffee and even was happy to add chocolate to the whipped cream. 

I got 2 small white mochas with whipped topping and a chocolate drizzle for 3 dollars on a Tuesday night 10 minutes till closing. And the coffee was even great. Very earthy flavor but still strong after all that sugar. I'm going again today.
author: Alicia B.

description:
The moment I saw "plenty of outlets" on someone's review I walked right past La Boulange and straight to Royal Ground Coffees. In fact, I'm here now :) On this beautifully sunny afternoon (where unfortunately I have some work to do) this is actually an ideal setting - quiet, with good coffee and full of character. One of the details I enjoy most is the "Customers Notebook", a notebook in which customers are encouraged to share their thoughts and doodles. 

The veggie bagel is not so good but I won't hold that against them. It could use some sprouts.
author: Sarah Z.

description: This place is a new favorite of mine. I like working from the Starbucks across the street, but sometimes there are no tables. Now I choose to come to this place from time to time without even checking the Bucks. Fresh squeezed orange juice for $2.75 is a great deal. One of the best hot chocolates I've ever tasted. I also have to recommend their smoothies and their veggie special bagel sandwich (I get it on a garlic bagel and it comes with cream cheese or hummus, tomato, cucumber, red onion, and avocado) for $3.95. There's usually always a spot to sit, and the staff is friendly.
author: Ashley D.

description: Love this little gem.  It feels very authentic among the Starbucks and La Boulanger on Polk Street.  My boyfriend also comes here every day and they know him by name.
author: Alyse S.

description: I love this place! Great coffee, really sweet staff, old school locals coming in and out. Also they make it easy for people with laptops to set up. Small, but homey.
author: Colleen F.

description:
I find myself without internet while in-between apartments and have been coming here for several days.  Several of the people working here are really friendly and nice, and I can see there are a lot of regulars that come in here. This place is cozy, I find it relaxing to use the internet here and have an iced green tea or a latte with a little smiley face in the foam.

The other day I was amused to see 2 different girls, students I guess, passed out in here.  One on a little upholstered chair and one passed out on top of her laptop.  No one bugged them and they eventually woke up from their catnips.  Oh, tired students!  Guess they needed some more coffee.
author: Muriel D.

description: Best neighborhood coffee shop. Very authentic and cozy coffee shop (with great WiFi). The coffee is great, the people who work here are extremely friendly, the food choices rock, the clientele are not the type of people who would be at Starbucks or St. Frank (nice change), and it always feels nice to support this type of coffee shop that is quickly becoming extinct in the city. Support this place so it doesn't leave!
author: Harmony P.

description:
Awww! The staff is so sweet and my latte with a smile in the foam is not only adorable but also yum!

all of this + cute homemade Valentine's cookie for breakfast? Yes!
author: Jodie B.

description:
Nice vib. Good decaf iced chai. The decaf iced coffee was a little bitter.

Now, the Chicken Turnover wasn't. Wasn't chicken, I mean. As we dissected it, we found lots of zuccini (yetch), but no chicken. Upon inquiry, the staff mentioned, "oh yeah, we don't have chicken anymore". They promptly replaced it with a delightful bacon and egg burrito, but, perhaps conditioned by our preceeding visit to Cole Hardware, I expected them to know their own inventory when I ordered. 

"Mellow" or "inattentive", it's not for me to say, but that attitude (and the Damoclian ceiling fan) explaned the lack of traffic on a Sunday morning.
author: Richard H.

description:
I guess I should blame myself a bit for ordering decaf house coffee, but I was pretty horrid.... -1 for bad coffee

The environment there seems warm and friendly - feels like a lot of locals like to try to get work done there. The noise level, though, is surprisingly quiet, which is good and bad, since anyone making any amount of noise (i.e. even just having a conversation) will be clearly audible throughout the cafe.

Girl behind the counter was very very nice, but not the most efficient person I've ever met.

+1 for outdoor seating
author: Vince L.

description:
This is the quintessential Polk street coffee shop. I adore it! 

Low prices, fabulous menu items, and most importantly, free internet access.  They also do NOT have a credit card minimum, and I love that as I never carry cash :)

There are recognizable regulars, but Royal Grounds is warm and welcoming to newcomers as well. My first time coming in, the  owner/barista was quick to make friendly conversation, and he remembered me afterwards. 

Locals playing chess/scrabble, students working on projects, or the elderly discussing politics -- all are regular sights and sounds at the Royal Grounds.

Highly recommend! Cheers!
author: Meghana D.

description: Well, I really really hate to rate this a one star because the people that work there are nice, the ambiance is awesome.   Additionally, the place is always clean filled with good people. However, I am a lox and bagels fan and got food poisoning this morning from eating this here and its kinda ruined my Monday morning.   I have had lox and bagels off this menu in the past and wasnt impressed but this was the only place open near my house this morning so I went for it again.   Please keep fresh salmon in your place or remove it from the menu altogether.  Thanks, prob need six months before I return but I likely will return.
author: Chris H.

description: I first started coming here because my friend wanted to support the small coffee shop owned by the Persian guy. Keep the money in the family! But wow... seriously the best cappuccino EVER. They are a bit slow, so I don't recommend stopping in if you are in a rush. The shop is super quaint with mismatch chairs. They use real mugs and glasses if you are drinking on the premises which rubs my eco nerve the right way. The staff are all very friendly and have a really good memory. They seem to know all of the regular customers by name. Starbucks and Peet's are right across the street, but are no competition to this neighborhood gem.
author: Mahta P.

description:
had a little study sesh here for two reasons: 
- they've got wi-fi
- they were the ONLY coffee shop in the area open past 9pm!  (they let me stay til 11pm)

had a tea and some reheated quiche (which was not bad at all).
nice cute girl working there too.  that's never a bad thing.
author: dan a.

description: I love the atmosphere here. Very homey and comfortable. The coffee is not my absolute favorite, slightly acidic, but I also love that they have a huge selection of teas. Also, they don't look at me weird when I order two shots of espresso poured into coffee. Yes, I'm aware that I'm an addict. Free wi-fi means I can work/study here which I love.
author: Kendra M.

description: Royal Grounds is one of the only coffee shops I know of in the area that is open late and always makes for nice stop before my late nite road travels. The best part about this place is the amazing barista that works there during the evening shifts. Not only does he make a helluva latte and hot chocolate, but he always takes the time for every customer to make a little face on top of their drinks with the foam and steamed milk. It may seem trivial and slightly time consuming, but I happen to think its AWESOME and it makes me smile everytime. Thanks Royal Ground!
author: Christina N.

description: perfect for working .... Rene is the man and the coffee is good as well as the pastries. I'd give 5 stars if they had power on both sides of the cafe.....
author: John R.

description:
Royal Ground Coffees is the stuff of short stories. Dim lighting, quirky patrons playing chess and discussing local politics, tasty chow, walls decked out in info on the locals and the locale.  If its walls could talk, they'd have volumes to say. And if coffee shops had digits, this one would have more character in its left pinky than the entire Starbucks franchise. I dig its reasonably priced beverages, its friendly service, its unapologetically large rice krispie treats and its late opening hours, which make it the perfect place to stop in for a hot post-dinner beverage. 

Its only downside is that people tend to squat there seemingly forever... so it can be hard to get a spot at an outdoor table, for instance. But then again I can't blame them for lingering.
author: Leela S.

description:
There's something to be said about consistency.

The coffee is always good, the service is friendly, and the atmosphere is  pleasant. 

I'd much rather come here than going to Pete's or Starbucks and there's a real sense of community.  I see a lot of the same people hanging out and they are never too shy to give a warm hello. 

If you're looking to study or a good game a chess this is the spot.  The free internet ain't bad either. 

I did sit next to two people who were obviously on an awkward Match.com date.  You could tell it wasn't a great fit and I couldn't help but listen to their boring yet addictive conversation. I'm a sucker for awkwardness.
author: Adam L.

description:
So it's Sunday night and I needed to get my econ on because I once again spent my weekend drinking and running around town with citizens of questionable character.

Of course Quetzal has to close at 10 so they can send the workers home and the owner can play Half-Life on the LAN.  I suppose they're entitled.

But the middle-aged Russian guy with a nose ring keeps this place open till 11 S-Th and midnight on the weekends.  It's one of those coffee shops that reminds me of Berkeley because I could probably have built the furniture in this place myself.  Everyone looks like a regular and a lot of the regulars look like Karl Marx.  I enjoyed the chai mocha.  It was spicy.

Thanks to my commie friend I was able to learn all about reaching long-term economic equilibrium by raising water buffalo in Vermont.  Seriously.

They also have a mural where I learned that coffee beans on a bush ripen at different times so the coffee picker chick has to go back every day and check on them to see if they're ready.  Coffee beans are such needy attention whores.  If my friends were like coffee bushes I would totally leave their industry.
author: Cassio P.

description:
Exclusively for my everyday visit... This is a top notch, top choice for the coffee spot. My favorite is my happy face mocha's.

When a question is proposed, "I like my coffee like I like my men... How do you like yours?" My answer is:

When I want a real cup of coffee,

Sipping strong coffee 

only to savor each sip 

to break down the boldness 

it ends up gliding along my taste buds 

for the smoothest texture 

and at the last sip I close my eyes passionately 

with slight sigh of pure excellence. 

I like my coffee like I like my men... in bed.
author: Dee C.

description:
Cute place, but small. They have some decent savory menu items, but of course, it's all about the coffee. I LOVE whatever kinda coffee it is that they brew. 

And they make latte floats. YUM!
author: Jen D.

description: Love this neighborhood coffee shop. Free internet, good coffee, and an awesome staff. A great place to sit for a few hours on the weekend to read, study, or people-watch. Only complaint is that it has become a bit too popular and it's sometimes tough to get a seat.
author: Steve V.

description:
Without the friendly atmosphere, organic free trade coffee, vast selection of teas, black forest cake, and FREE INTERNET of Royal Grounds, I may very well never study. I live in an apartment with no desk and three male roommates; studying at home is virtually impossible. Luckily, Royal Grounds has everything I need to come and camp out with my books for 5 hours, without ever having to leave. On top of all this, they have a loyal set of regulars that congregate here most evenings, playing chess and talking politics that make for great people watching when I take my zone out brain breaks.

So I thank you Royal Grounds, for your sugar, caffeine, wireless, eclectic crowd and academic support. My parents also thank you.
author: Taylor E.

description:
Probably second best in San Francisco, next to my neighborhood Cafe Bello.  I ordered a medium four shot mocha, and it was very smooth, and strong at the same time.  But oddly, I am ready for a nap.  Some of you know that caffeine has no noticeable effect on me.  Others closer to me know me as a "coffee snob."  I agree that I am, and I just want good coffee.  Don't pass Folgers on me and tell me that's it's Peet's Major D Blend, because that's not gonna happen.

This place has a neighborly feel about it.  You can tell that the regulars are known by name, and their drinks are ready for them as they enter.  Great place to grab some joe, pastry, cookie or whatever, and hang out, check e-mail, etc.
author: Michael M.

description:
Great lil' coffee hangout...  open til midnight.

for those late nights when I wanna be at a cafe sipping on a latte and working on the laptop, with free wifi. Homey, comfortable feel, and stan getz jazz.
author: Vicky P.

description:
This is my morning coffee joint - and if it ever leaves me there would be a $1.75 hole the size of large iced coffee in my heart. I enjoy my morning tradition of Royal Ground. 

The creepy guy in the black cap whose always outside, legs crossed, smoking. The two construction workers who are usually chatting over their morning brew. My friendly morning barristas - it all makes for a nice AM routine. 

My only complaint is inconsistent Chai Lattes - even if you're picky and as for sweet chai latte every time.
author: Tom C.

description:
I love Real Chai... Not that I won't settle for the syrupy version when I have to.. But Royal grounds has the good stuff. 
I was a fan of their veggie special bagel... but the lox and cream cheese bagel was lacking some oomph (oomph being tomato onion non dyed lox...) 
the decor feels cozy and well coffee shop like... looks like the have many regulars which usually is a good sign. I am a fan but oy vay hold the lox ....
author: Crystal P.

description:
A quintessential neighborhood cafe with a cast of characters that would make the creator of Gilligan's Island jealous. This cafe is the "neighbor" in neighborhood.

As for the coffee, for some a bit on the strong side, but stands up to a healthy dose of half-and-half.  The strong flavor carries over to the espresso, which is good for milky drinks like caps and lattes.

The menu includes sandwiches, calzones, fruit smoothies, bagels and more, making the RG a good place to stop if you just want a quick snack as there aren't many super casual spots for quick eats left in the 'hood.  

The owner has found an Innovative and subtle way to keep laptop users from soaking up table space all day -- electrical outlets are only on one side of the cafe.  :o
author: Tom Y.

description:
The actual coffee is just okay...true fans of the beverage have MANY other options in the hood.

However, if you need an "experience" with your java, this is definitely the place to be...at any given time, you can participate in a) intense political debates b) intense social commentary c) intense board games. 

Oh, and don't miss the fun when random tourists wander in...it's a treat! On really intense days, you can just see them thinking "so this is what native SFers are like!" before they quietly duck out and make their way to the safe and familiar environs of the Starbucks down the street.
author: Julia C.

description:
For many months this place was my part time office during the day and sometimes still is. This is the canonical coffee shop that is warm, inviting, and filled with locals where lots of folks know one another. I don't get the coffee often here as I'm mostly a tea drinker but when there's room here this is my first choice of coffee shops to work in when I feel like getting out of the house or not going into my real office.

If you're new to the hood or just moving back like I was a year ago this is a great way to meet your friendly neighbors.
author: Michael K.

description: I look forward to my mornings at Royal Ground. The staff is incredible - so friendly, so welcoming, and so generous. Make sure to order foam with whatever drink you get. It's outrageously delicious. I never write Yelp reviews but I had to for this small, family business. Unfortunately they have to compete with big names like Peet's and Starbucks right across the street, but I love the local vibe here. It's my favorite!
author: Samantha B.

description:
Met my friend Kovacs here.  He's a regular.  But, not as regular as some of the other characters here.  I have walked by this place a million times because it seemed sort of like a cave, and now I know why.  Let me describe the real regulars.  This is all hearsay:

- some ex radio personality from the '80s, now a movie critic who is too cheap to get internet at his house, so he comes here.  Thinks he owns the place, so be prepared to deal with him if you do something he doesn't like.

- Lady who freaked out because I put my stuff down at a table before getting my drink.

- Retired painter who pays all his bills using his social security check at the beginning of the month, and spends the rest of lottery tickets.  Rent control at it's best.  God forbid these guys are priced out of the city!

There are 10 tables in the place, so that's a good % of them taken up by these people.  Of course, you have to listen to their conversations too...
author: Chris N.

description: Cute spot to bring laptop to, great coffee, this this review only pertains to the time I ordered a lox bagel with cream cheese and capers. It was absolutely disgusting. The lox was not fresh and tasted fake. Yuck, yuck. I should have tried bagelry.
author: Jeanne C.

description: Didn't try the coffee so I can't comment, but this little shop has free internet and even a free laptop. Pretty typical neighborhood-ish joint, nothing fancy or exciting here.
author: Jeremy S.

description:
Excellent atmosphere, friendly service and great hours.  I like that they offer pots of tea on request and will even refill hot water.   Whereas some places are either super loud or study-quiet, Royal Grounds is right in between - and generally conducive to studying (despite occasional noisy crowds).  Oh, and the free wi-fi (ZR internet) has a supposed 2-hour limit, but I've yet to be kicked off.  Lastly, snacks are good - pretty typical spread - but they are consistently out of bagels for the bagel and hummus choice I love.

This is not to be confused with the other Royal Grounds a few blocks down on Polk, which I don't find as appealing.
author: Amber M.

description: I love a good cup of coffee. But even beyond that, I love a good coffee shop. There is something to be said for the way the atmosphere enhance or deter how well that beverage is going to journey down the esophagus. Sitting at a round table by the window, my coffee definitely had happy travels. Coffee was a little bit weak tasting, and I probably wouldn't come here for the sole purpose of a cup to go. But the service was super friendly, and the surrounding decor provided a cozy feel without the dinginess that sometimes accompanies that. Loved the selection of treats, and the coffee is reasonably priced considering the location.
author: Claire M.

description:
Although coffee is not phenomenal the energy is.
Everytime I've been here the workers are super cute almost cartoonish characters and for some reason are always in a happy mood. That is some osmosis process of starting the day or mid-day and actually does rub-off. 
Petite space but typically nice/peaceful place to-do whatever. Actually the place feels nicer (personally) sans computers.
author: ninja M.

description: I like this place.  Their coffee is moderately good.  There's a fair amount of people, but not crowded.  And, Free Internet with plenty of outlets.  That's one thing that always bothers me about Starbucks; they often only have a couple outlets in the whole store.  Staff seems pretty friendly and there seems to be quite a few regular customers.
author: Ted G.

description:
I'm just okay on this place because they only have the ZR Net Wifi - so I get 2 free hours and thats it...

good panini though!
author: Lindsay T.

description: on my way out on an adventurous shopping day I stopped in for a coffee and got the service that makes me want to go back. A young sweetheart named Marsha gave me directions and was so kind.  That's the way customer service should be.  AND the coffee is delicious.
author: Roni R.

description:
Quirky charming man behind the counter.
Coming from the east coast, I didn't have high expectations for the apple cider I ordered (it's mid-August after all), but I was pleasantly surprised!  It was piping hot and perfectly spiced with the cinnamon stick still in the cup!  Mellow but cheerful atmosphere, and a bit of outdoor seating too.  I'll be back!
author: Anna R.

description:
This is the type of place where you can order your drink and sit for as long as you want. I feel bad about taking up their table space but then I see other people who had already finished my drink before I came in and still after 1.5 hours haven't gotten anything else.

If you want to do reading here I recommend bringing headphones. Since the place is small, one conversation will dominate and be very distracting.

For some reason I get annoyed that every time I come here the same two guys are here (among other people that I hadn't seen before).

The lattes are average. They could be hotter. The coffee is great.

One thing I love about this place is that it is open late. Midnight on Friday and Saturday, I believe.
author: Stu M.

description:
A nice neighborhood coffee shop.  They show local artists' work on the walls, have lots of reading material, friendly staff.

The internet access, though, is not free, as someone else suggested. 

One thing they used to have was a frequent customer coffee card.  I had mine all filled up and then some, was owed about 4 free coffees, which I was saving for a day when I forgot to bring cash -- and then was out of town for a bit and came back and they said they had "discontinued" that program.  A bit annoying.
author: H.A. ..

description: I went there to do some work.  It's a quiet and quaint place to read or zone off into internet world.  It's not really the best place for a coffee date because everyone would be able to hear your entire conversation.  It's a 3-star for me because the place is small and has limited electrical outlets.  There were only electrical outlets on one side of the coffee shop and of course they were all occupied.
author: Wa W.

description: Latte was a little too strong with bitterness from espresso. Nice atmosphere to talk with friends after eating dinner in neighborhood restaurant.
author: Cruiser L.

description:
Free wifi, open 'til 11, charming atmosphere, reasonable prices. What more could you ask for?

Good coffee, I guess. I'm no real coffee expert, but I got a standard small and it was decent. And it came in a cute glass rather than the standard Starbucks-looking cup.

I'll be back, and next time I'll try something more exotic.
author: Chris L.

description:
The vibe is nice here.  There's hardwood everything- floors, tables, benches along the wall, chairs, and the places just feels warm.  There's cute music from some other country playing in the background and it's decorated like you would expect your grandma's kitchen to be, with scattered nick knacks everywhere.  But, I came here hoping to find a new spot in my area to get free wi-fi and I'm not sure that this is it.  

There is free Internet here, but I ordered a mocha that tastes more like watered down hot chocolate than anything.  My review is kind of mixed, I gave it bonus points for mood and the people here seem to be regulars, but my drink could have been better if I'd just gone across the street to Starbucks.  Plus, she gave me a to-go cup when I was planning on staying here.  Guess she's trying to tell me something?
----

2 hours later I feel like I need to buy coffee somewhere else to get my juice.  I guess she was telling me with the to-go cup that I should stop by Peet's next door, on my way out.
author: Ward D.

description:
Not bad, Sunday morning had a lox bagel that was soo phat, it was falling out of thee mouth, and I'm a good eater. Sat read the NY Times and stared at the foggy city that reminds me of...yeah what dis it remind me of, I guess it was like sitting in Amsterdam that day with the bohemian jazz in the background, the french girls chatting next to me about one of the girl's bf with a lame tattoo on his arm.
My cappuccino was good, and frothy, overall the stay was quick and fortunate as the smell in there reminds me of my grade school's cafeteria on rainy days - St. James.
author: Fernando T.

description: A friend and I meet here regularly for really great lattes (we get them to go and stroll up Polk Street, rarely do we find a seat here). We only ever get them prepared with their fortified whole milk (fat seems to make a lot of things taste better), but it has been thus far about as perfect as coffee gets for me. So creamy and delish that I have found the addition of sweetener pretty unnecessary. I went to the other location on Polk near Sacramento Street and didn't have the same experience. I'll stick to the Russian Hill location for my morning coffee on weekends, unless I can get down to the Saturday Market at the Ferry Building for a cup of Blue Bottle Coffee.
author: Sara C.

description:
great place to sit and read or do work or whatever. 
friendly staff, huge selection of tea.

the coffee is...not to my liking...that is as euphemistic as I can be about the coffee.

They have good tea though and it has much better cafe ambiance than the other choices in the area.
author: Nilu r.

description: After many years of the same decor, this wonderful neighborhood place just got even more comfortable!  Comfy armchairs, no more hard benches, window seats, outdoor seating, fresh coat of paint, all without loosing the feel of being Russian Hill's living room and kitchen.  They serve coffee like it should be served, with love and comfort.  The staff is so friendly that they remember the names and the quirks of the regulars.   And the owner, Alix, is adorable, smart, with always a wry observation and a touch of humor on the politics of the day while he takes your order.  Wonderful place to start or end your day!
author: Janet C.

description:
I like drip coffee and theirs is pretty good.  They have free wi-fi, so that's a plus.  It's cozy inside and I like the wall of animal photos...can I add my cat??  

I would have given 5 stars but I was baffled that they didn't know what a cafe au lait was.  Isn't that a fairly standard coffee drink?  I explained it was half coffee and half steamed milk (it was getting late in the day so I didn't want too much caffeine) and I asked for nonfat milk...instead I got a full cup of coffee with with a tiny shot of steamed whole milk.  I'm not one to get my feathers ruffled easily so it was no big deal.
author: Lew D.

description: As a picky Seattle coffee drinker, this place was just like home.  I got my latte exactly like I ordered it and it was delicious!
author: Karin B.

description: Cool little coffee shop.  Wireless internet access.  A comfortable place to hang out with your laptop or a book.
author: Russel S.

description: My one star can only speak for a double latte and a soy hot chocolate. They were both horribly shocking, the taste of the soy hot coco felt like they just used choc. soy milk and steamed  it. My latte was nasty took two sips and threw it away. they over steamed the milk and  used a perforated spoon to catch all the foam... i was saddened =( must try again i suppose.
author: stephen c.

description: Gad zukes!  This place is great.  I'm rediscovering it now that I'm back on regular coffee.  For a time there I switched to decaf, and Peet's has the only potable decaf of which I know.  For a good, strong cup of REGULAR on the other hand, this place is tops.  Very nice folks behind the counter here; chill clientele as well.  I'm a fan of the occasional double-espresso, and this joint serves one of the best shots around.
author: Matt W.

description: Honestly I don't come here for the coffee. The coffee is good though. I come here for the characters. Monday night scrabble is a good time, and the most awesome film critic in the world parks out there, and is available if you need some in person advice. It's like family, not a coffee shop. Just order something if you want to access the free internet - I got in trouble once for being a mooch. Overall, a great place to do some work.
author: Stacy H.

description:
heads up. plenty of eclectics hanging around outside waiting to chat. yes that is part of what makes SF great, but if you're not prepared, you will may be left with a sour taste of this place.  

Royal Ground coffee is a great place to study because they have free internet, good tea and coffee, and its a crazy chill environment.  Very unlike a starbucks where if you're there for more than an hour you're gonna get some dirty looks.  The workers there are really nice, the atmosphere is low key, and I believe they're open til 11.
author: kim l.

description:
love this place! their service is incredibly friendly, free wi-fi, really adorable pet pictures on the wall, and when i ran down to get a decaf mocha at 10:57 pm (serious chocolate craving) and asked if it was too late for espresso, the guy said "nooo never too late" and then made a happy design with the chocolate on top. 
Also, the owner (i think?) told me the scoop on loading metered spots and held the door open for me when i was moving in (okay, so maybe i'm skewed since i live like right upstairs).
but still, that is just awesome.
author: Cayla W.

description:
this place has caught my eye a few times, and i made a conscious decision to try this place some day. on my walk to peet's, i passed by and figured that day would be today. it's a very cute, comfortable cafe on the corner. i ordered two drinks. soy vanilla latte & non-fat vanilla latte.

i probably said it four times. soy. vanilla. latte. i think that the concept of the cafe is great, but the coffee wasn't at all what i was expecting. it was burnt, and fairly bitter. my soy vanilla latte also lacked vanilla. oyy.

the offered an assortment of sandwiches and paninis. the only breakfast-type item available was a bagel with peanut butter. pass.

UPDATE: my friend would like me to add that her latte was yummy and vanilla-y. coming from a starbucks fanatic, that's saying a lot.
author: Nancy P.

description: The coffee here is terrible.  Very bitter and the espresso drinks also leave something to be desired.  I have ended up here on two occasions because nothing else in the neighborhood was open.  Go to north beach for real coffee worth the walk or cab ride.
author: Moe J.

description: Had the single espresso; pretty good, not cheap, but hit the spot. Love the notebook for writing whatever and the guys playing chess in the corner--I don't know if that's a regular thing.
author: C.J. J.

description: When you really need the strong stuff, this is the place to go.  I recommend getting an au lait to soften it up.  Nothing will get you going faster!
author: Amme P.

description: Cozy and warm. Not too sweet of drinks. Free wireless service. Great attentive service. Good coffee. I just wish this place smelled more like coffee than stale wood.
author: Judy L.
