description: On average Sunday morning, the roommate and pull on our finest sweats (or the clothes we were wearing the day before), and take our hungover, sorry selves for a stroll down Polk Street to re-enter the world of the living. First stop? Always Royal Oak for a sugar-free vanilla latte (her) and a medium coffee (me). She loves the lattes and the oat cakes, I love the caffeine that feeds my addiction and the great neighborhoody-feel. We keep meaning to check out some of the board games, but on the typical Sunday, that just seems overly ambitious.
author: Chelsea R.

description: Part of the "international section" of Polk street.   A great little coffee shop that makes you feel welcome.    Staff is cool and fun to talk to, i go there often with a book or with my laptop to do some work.  The free-wireless that many speak of is from the shop next door.   Keep it free!
author: Dan G.

description: This place does have great coffee I would give the coffee 4 stars. I prefer it to the Peet's across the street. On a quiet day, it's nice, almost like a little tavern (because it's dark with a lot of wooden tables). The drink maker is a man of few words, but he does say " Have a nice day" after he hands you the drink. The pastries look and taste forlorn. The fixins station is located in this little nook that only person can be in at a time. Their counter should be higher to hide the not clean looking prep space in the back. Internet is available for a fee.
author: B C.

description: Free WIFI, and a very chill atmosphere.  Excellent coffee and lots of tasty snacks.  The church pew seating gets little uncomfortable after a while, but that's very minor.
author: Jeremy A.

description: Royal Ground Coffee has 8 or 9 locations in San Francisco... I think. I've been to a few of them and this one in particular has the worst chai I've had to date.  The other drinks are okay, but other than that, nothing to rave about.  Sometimes I get the munchies, but for some reason, this one has a smaller selection than say the one by GGP in the Richmond district.  Sadly, in this part of the city, I'd hightail it to Peets just a few minutes away.
author: Desiree C.

description: IMHO, Royal Grounds produces the best coffee in The City.
author: Henry W.

description:
This Royal Ground location makes some of the best drinks I've had in the city. Their chai tea's are great! 
It's too bad the cafe itself is not more of a pleasant atmosphere to hang out in.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
I love this place.  It is cozy, the people who work there are personable and there are tons of regulars.  I'd have to say that cafes like this are one of the reasons why I love San Francisco so much.

There is also a game night here on Monday nights.  Lots of people from the neighborhood meet to play chess and scrabble.  It's a great way to build community.
author: A B.

description: The usual folks who work there are friendly, it's cozy, got nice outdoor seating in the midst of Polk street, and has a good soundtrack with lots of Air and Radiohead. A good spot.
author: Stewart H.

description: came here midday to work (a bit), and get some fresh air.  their internet limits you to two (2) one hour sessions, a bit of a nuisance since i still had plenty of work today, and we were still paying customers, refilling our drinks regularly.  also had the veggie panini which was pretty good, but what i really wanted was the veggie bagel sandwich.  but i'm a bonehead, and in bonehead language, "panini" and "bagel" are the same thing.
author: Sean L.

description: this is a great neighborhood coffee place. the coffee is great, the bagels are good and staff is very very nice. they also have internet access! cash or check only though!
author: Jenifer B.

description: Of course the coffee is delicious (we use Max's Blend at home), but this Royal Grounds is a real neighborhood asset.  Great atmosphere, friendly service, very homey.  Displays local art and local pet pictures.  A great place to hang out.
author: David D.

description: good coffe and contrary to what people say about alex the guy who dont talk much, well start talking and he will talk to u too..
author: jigi s.
